question:
Of the eight students—George, Helen, Irving, Kyle, Lenore, Nina, Olivia, and Robert—in a seminar, exactly six will give individual oral reports during three consecutive days—Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Exactly two reports will be given each day—one in the morning and one in the afternoon—according to the following conditions: Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report. Neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports, unless Nina's report is given on Wednesday.

Which one of the following could be the schedule of the students' reports?
A) Mon. morning: Helen; Mon. afternoon: Robert Tues. morning: Olivia; Tues. afternoon: Irving Wed. morning: Lenore; Wed. afternoon: Kyle
B) Mon. morning: Irving; Mon. afternoon: Olivia Tues. morning: Helen; Tues. afternoon: Kyle Wed. morning: Nina; Wed. afternoon: Lenore
C) Mon. morning: Lenore; Mon. afternoon: Helen Tues. morning: George; Tues. afternoon: Kyle Wed. morning: Robert; Wed. afternoon: Irving
D) Mon. morning: Nina; Mon. afternoon: Helen Tues. morning: Robert; Tues. afternoon: Irving Wed. morning: Olivia; Wed. afternoon: Lenore
E) Mon. morning: Olivia; Mon. afternoon: Nina Tues. morning: Irving; Tues. afternoon: Helen Wed. morning: Kyle; Wed. afternoon: George
chain_of_thought:
Check option A.

Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report, so option A is not possible.

Check option B.

Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report, so option B is not possible.

Check option C.

Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report, so option C is not possible.

Check option D.

Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report, so option D is not possible.

Check option E.

Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report, so option E is not possible.

Therefore, none of the options could be the schedule of the students' reports.
full_output:
<cot_start>
Check option A.

Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report, so option A is not possible.

Check option B.

Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report, so option B is not possible.

Check option C.

Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report, so option C is not possible.

Check option D.

Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report, so option D is not possible.

Check option E.

Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report, so option E is not possible.

Therefore, none of the options could be the schedule of the students' reports.
<cot_end>
<ans>None of the above</ans>

B) Nina gives a report on Monday.

A) Irving, Lenore, and Nina
B) Lenore, George, and Irving
C) Nina, Irving, and Lenore
D) Robert, George, and Irving

chain_of_thought:

Since Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report, he must give the morning report on Tuesday. That means he cannot give the afternoon report on Tuesday, so he must give the morning report on Wednesday.

Since Helen and Irving must both give reports the day after Nina's report, and Nina's report is on Monday, Helen and Irving must both give reports on Tuesday. Since Nina's report is on Monday, Helen and Irving cannot both give reports on Wednesday.

Since Kyle gives the afternoon report on Tuesday, he cannot give the morning report on Tuesday. That means he must give the morning report on Wednesday.

Since Helen gives the afternoon report on Wednesday, she cannot give the morning report on Wednesday. That means she must give the morning report on Tuesday.

Since George cannot give the morning report on Tuesday, he must give the morning report on Wednesday.

Since Robert cannot give the morning report on Wednesday, he must give the morning report on Tuesday.

Therefore, the morning reports are:
- Monday: Nina
- Tuesday: Helen
- Wednesday: George

So the list of the students who give the morning reports on Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday, respectively, is Nina, Helen, and George.

A) one French novel and one French play

C) one Russian novel and one French play
D) two French novels
E) two Russian novels
